metadata.title: CVE-2024-21157 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:InnoDB).  Supported versions that are affected are 8.0.36 and prior and8.4.0 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows high privilegedattacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQLServer.  Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result inunauthorized ability to cause a hang or frequently repeatable crash(complete DOS) of MySQL Server. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 4.9 (Availabilityimpacts).  CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-21157` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient21 - 8.0.37-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
mysql-client - 8.0.37-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
mysql-client-8.0 - 8.0.37-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
mysql-client-core-8.0 - 8.0.37-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
mysql-router - 8.0.37-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
mysql-server - 8.0.37-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
mysql-server-8.0 - 8.0.37-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
mysql-server-core-8.0 - 8.0.37-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
mysql-source-8.0 - 8.0.37-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
mysql-testsuite - 8.0.37-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
mysql-testsuite-8.0 - 8.0.37-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-8.0 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.37-0ubuntu0.20.04.3').
mariadb-10.3 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
